overview:
Michael Witz is currently the founder and CEO of Mob Science, one of the first Facebook gaming companies that in 2009 was the 7th largest Facebook developer in terms of reach, with 27,000,000 users in the month of December alone.

Michael is a long time creative startup guy with a history of pushing the envelope in the online consumer space. He has always had an instinct for identifying the next big thing. In 1998 he raised over $10 Million in capital for a start-up called StockJungle.com that was the first online investment network that was used to create a real SEC Registered mutual fund. Called the Community Intelligence Fund, it was able to earn a market beating track record, but the funds to operate the company ran out before the assets under management got big enough to support the business.

After StockJungle.com, he went on to bootstrap with two partners a new start-up called RightSide Advisors, that went on to become a moderately successful publisher of online investment research, newsletters and software tools. RightSide was sold for a nice exit to a private equity firm in 2006.

Michael is married with 3 children and lives in the San Diego area.
